headline.main: THE WRECK OF THE STEAM-SHIP ETEN

docs.snippet: PANAMA, Aug. 2.--From Chili we have news of the loss of the Pacific Steam Navigation Company's steamer Eten, about 70 miles north of Valparaiso. Our correspondent, writing from Lima, July 20, says: "We have advices of the total loss of the Pacific...
docs.abstract: Eten, Pacific Steam Navigation Company's Steamer; 100 Lives Lost
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, Aug. 2.--From Chili we have news of the loss of the Pacific Steam Navigation Company's steamer Eten, about 70 miles north of Valparaiso. Our correspondent, writing from Lima, July 20, says: "We have advices of the total loss of the Pacific Steam Navigation Company's steamer Eten, Capt. Coathupe, on the morning of the 15th inst., at a point known as...

headline.main: LOSS OF A PACIFIC STEAMER; ABOUT ONE HUNDRED LIVES LOST. THE STEAMER ETEN, OF THE PACIFIC STEAM NAVIGATION LINE, WRECKED NEAR VALPARAISO--DREADFUL SUFFERINGS OF PASSENGERS ON THE ROCKS--INABILITY TO SAVE THEM OWING TO STORMY WEATHER --THEORIES REGARDING THE DISASTER.

docs.snippet: It has generally been my luck to be on hand when things don't go right, and if there's any bad luck, any " accident by flood or field," you may expect to hear of my being there. " 'Twas ever thus in childhood's hour." I am a sure card for a blow-u...
docs.lead_paragraph: It has generally been my luck to be on hand when things don't go right, and if there's any bad luck, any " accident by flood or field," you may expect to hear of my being there. " 'Twas ever thus in childhood's hour." I am a sure card for a blow-up; to be relied on for plumping on a sunken rock, and am beginning to deserve confidence

headline.main: THE COLLISION OFF CAPE RACE.; The Arabia and Europa Accident and its Incidents--Panic of Passengers--Official Surliness--Persinent Reflections.

docs.snippet: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, Capt. LEITCH, left Liverpool at 4 1/2 o'clock P. M. of Saturday, April 24, and arrived at Halifax at 10 o'clock A. M. on Tuesday, May 4. The Europa reports, April 24, passed the American ships S. R. Mallory, of Key...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, Capt. LEITCH, left Liverpool at 4 1/2 o'clock P. M. of Saturday, April 24, and arrived at Halifax at 10 o'clock A. M. on Tuesday, May 4. The Europa reports, April 24, passed the American ships S. R. Mallory, of Key West, Ocean Pearl, of Portland. West Point, of New-York, City of New-York, and British ship Talavora, all bound into Liverpool.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; THE UNITED STATES AND SPAIN. Cailton Buoyant--Consols 96 3-4a96 1-8. NARROW ESCAPE OF NENASAHIB LATER FROM INDIA. No Further Proceedings to be Taken Against Dr. Bernard. Arrival of the Europa at Halifax. BRITISH PARLIAMENTARY PROCEEDINGS. Burning of the Clipper Ship James Baires.

docs.snippet: The Collins steamship Baltic, Capt. COMSTOCK, from Liverpool at about 4 o'clock on the afternoon of the 14th October, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon, with the mail and passengers, and $360,000 in specie. The screw-steamer Jura arrived at...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Collins steamship Baltic, Capt. COMSTOCK, from Liverpool at about 4 o'clock on the afternoon of the 14th October, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon, with the mail and passengers, and $360,000 in specie. The screw-steamer Jura arrived at Cork from St. John, N. B., on the 11th inst.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. Effect of the Financial Crisis in England. Further Advance in the Bank's Rate of Discount. DECLINE IN CONSOLS. Great Sensation on the London Stock Exchange. TWO MILLIONS EN ROUTE FOR THE UNITED STATES IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. NINTH VICTORY OF GEN. HAVELOCK. SAFETY OF LUCKNOW. Loss of Two American Ships and Ten Lives on the English Coast. Victory of the American Mare "Prioress" at Newmarket.
